intro: Start your business with ease by registering your sole proprietorship firm online. Fast, affordable, and fully digital registration for individuals planning to start a business in India.

tabs.title: What is Sole Proprietorship Registration?
content: Sole proprietorship registration online in India is the easiest way for individuals to start a business legally and independently. It’s ideal for freelancers, traders, and small business owners who want full control with minimal hassle. With this setup, you can get essential licenses like GST registration, a trade license for sole proprietorship, and build your business credibility fast.
Common Types of Sole Proprietorships include:
• Service-Based – Freelancers, consultants, designers
• Trading – Retail/wholesale shops, online sellers (register a proprietorship firm online)
• Manufacturing – Small production units
• Online Business – E-commerce, digital marketers
• Professional Practice – CA, CS, doctors, lawyers
• Home-Based – Catering, tuition, craft sellers
• Freelancers – Writers, coders (apply for sole proprietorship online for compliance)
Rules and Regulations for Sole Proprietorship:
• Sole proprietors must follow key Indian laws to operate legally and stay compliant.
• Income Tax Act requires tax filing on business profits and PAN registration.
• GST registration is mandatory if annual turnover crosses ₹20 lakhs (₹10 lakhs in some states).
• Businesses must file monthly and yearly GST returns and pay taxes on time.
• Shop & Establishment Acts require registration of business premises as per state rules.
• These Acts also cover working hours, employee rights, and shop operations.
• Labour laws like ESI and EPF apply under certain circumstances.
• Some states charge professional tax from sole proprietors, with varying rates.
• Food businesses must get FSSAI registration to ensure safety and hygiene standards.
• Businesses that impact the environment need pollution board approvals and clearances.
• Certain industries like pharma or textiles need extra licenses and quality certifications.

tabs.title: Key Characteristics of Sole Proprietorship
content: Here’s what makes a sole proprietorship unique for small business owners in India:-
• Single Owner Model: Only one person owns and controls the business—no partners allowed. Full decision-making power rests with the proprietor.
• No Separate Legal Identity: The business and the owner are treated as one under the law. Personal assets may be used to handle business debts.
• Unlimited Liability: If the business faces losses or legal claims, the owner is fully responsible. There’s no limit to personal financial risk.
• Simple & Quick Registration: No complex documents like MOA/AOA or partnership deeds needed. Just basic steps to register sole proprietorship online India.
• Direct Tax Handling: Business income is taxed as the owner’s personal income. No need for a separate business ITR—profits/losses are included in the individual’s return.
• High Operational Flexibility: No board meetings or legal consultations needed for decisions. Easy to adapt to market changes and new opportunities.
• Limited Funding Options: Raising capital from outside investors is tough. Business growth depends mostly on the proprietor’s own funds.
• Easy Exit Process: Closure is simple, with no formal winding-up procedure. The business ends automatically if the owner passes away or becomes unable to run it.
Register With Us makes it easy to handle your entire sole proprietorship registration procedure, from forms to PAN and tax compliance, we’ve got you.

tabs.title: Why Should You Register a Sole Proprietorship?
content: Here are a few advantages of sole proprietorship in India:
• Legal Business Identity: Gives your business a formal identity, making it look serious and professional.
• Banking & Financial Access: Helps open business bank accounts and apply for loans or credit easily.
• Tax Compliance & Benefits: Supports GST compliance, tax deductions, and smooth PAN and tax compliance.
• Eligibility for Government Schemes: Lets you access MSME schemes, and subsidies.
• Legal Protection & Documentation: Keeps your business legally sound and helps avoid fines or disputes.
• Scope for Expansion: Builds a legal base to grow or shift to a private limited company setup later.
• Professional Credibility: Boosts your reputation with customers, vendors, and stakeholders.
• Contractual Power: Allows you to legally sign supplier deals, service contracts, and client agreements.

tabs.title: Eligibility for Sole Proprietorship Registration
content: • Only individuals can apply; companies or groups can’t form a sole proprietorship.
• The applicant must be 18 years or older and legally allowed to do business.
• Must have legal residency status in India, even if not a citizen.
• A valid PAN card is required for tax compliance and official registration.
• An Aadhaar card or a valid ID proof is needed for verification and compliance.
• Provide business address proof, which can be owned, rented, or even residential.
• No partner should be included who is legally disqualified or declared insolvent.
• Must be capable of handling regulatory and tax obligations under Indian law.
Meeting these conditions makes it easier to apply for sole proprietorship online and ensures a smooth process under the sole proprietorship registration procedure.

content: 1. Identity and Address Proof
• PAN Card
• Aadhaar Card

2. Business Address Proof

6. Financial and Tax Documents

7. Additional Supporting Documents
• Business Plan
• Partnership NOC (if applicable)
• Family Consent (if required by state)
• Educational Certificates (for professional services)

tabs.title: How to Register a Sole Proprietorship in India?
content: • Choose a unique business name and clearly define your business activity.
• Gather PAN card, Aadhaar card, photos, and address proof of the applicant.
• Provide valid business address documents (rent deed, utility bill, or NOC).
• Apply for a PAN card if you don’t already have one.
• Register for GST if your turnover crosses the mandatory threshold.
• Get a Shop and Establishment License from local authorities.
• Open a current account in your business name using the required documents.
• Register for Professional Tax if applicable in your state.
• Apply for industry-specific licenses like FSSAI or a trade license for sole proprietorship.
• Complete Udyam registration benefits under MSME for added advantages.
• Set up basic accounting and compliance systems for filings and audits.

• Professional Tax Registration – ₹300 – ₹1,000
• FSSAI Registration – ₹100 (Basic), ₹3,000 (State), ₹7,500 (Central)
• Business Bank Account Opening – ₹500 – ₹2,000
• Professional Registration Assistance – ₹5,000 – ₹15,000
2. Ongoing Compliance Costs
• GST Filing (Quarterly) – ₹1,000 – ₹3,000
• Income Tax Return Filing – ₹1,500 – ₹5,000 (Annually)
• License Renewals – ₹500 – ₹2,000 (Annually)
• Professional Tax (Yearly) – ₹200 – ₹2,500
• Accounting & Bookkeeping (Monthly) – ₹1,000 – ₹5,000
• Audit Fees – ₹10,000 – ₹25,000 (if turnover > ₹1 crore)
• Legal Compliance Services – ₹5,000 – ₹15,000 (Annually)

faqs: 1. How do I register a sole proprietorship online in India?

→ You can register a sole proprietorship online in India by selecting a business name, gathering key documents like PAN and Aadhaar, and applying for registrations like GST, trade license, and shop and establishment license.
2. Do I need GST registration for a sole proprietorship?
→ If your annual turnover exceeds ₹20 lakhs (₹10 lakhs for some states), GST registration is mandatory. Even if it's not, many people get it anyway to build credibility and claim input tax credit.
3. Is there a difference between a sole proprietorship and a private limited company?

→ Yes, a sole proprietorship is owned and controlled by one person, with unlimited liability. A private limited company setup offers limited liability and is more suitable for scaling and attracting investors.
4. What licenses are required for a sole proprietorship?
→ You may need a trade license, GST registration, professional tax, and industry-specific licenses like FSSAI (for food businesses). It depends on what your business does and where it's located.
5. Can I open a business bank account with just a sole proprietorship?
→ Yes, but you’ll need valid registration proofs (like GST certificate or Shop & Establishment license), PAN, and identity/address documents. Most banks ask for at least two forms of business proof.
6. Is it better to register under MSME (Udyam)?
→ Yes, though it’s optional, Udyam registration includes easier access to loans, government schemes, and tender participation, so it’s highly recommended, especially for small businesses.

intro: Want to build a business with partners and still protect your personal assets? LLP registration services online India is your smartest option. An LLP (Limited Liability Partnership) gives you the legal protection of a company with the flexibility of a partnership. We make your limited liability partnership registration process seamless, digital, and totally stress-free & hassle free.

tabs.title: What is LLP Registration?
content: LLP stands for Limited Liability Partnership, a hybrid structure that merges the flexibility of partnerships with the liability protection of companies. It’s governed by the LLP Act, 2008 and registered through the MCA portal.
Once registered, your firm gets a unique LLPIN (Limited Liability Partnership Identification Number), an LLP incorporation certificate, and legal status to operate across India.
Types of LLPs in India:
• Domestic LLP – Two or more Indian partners
• Foreign LLP – Includes foreign nationals or businesses
• Professional LLP – For legal, financial, or design professionals
• Startup LLP – For new businesses under startup India recognition
• Small LLP – Turnover under ₹40 lakhs
• Converted LLP – From existing firms or companies
LLP Registration Legal Rules:
• Limited Liability Partnership Act, 2008: Provides the foundational legal framework for the formation, operation, and dissolution of LLPs in India.
• Limited Liability Partnership Rules, 2009: Details procedural aspects including registration, conversion, and compliance requirements.
• Companies Act, 2013 (for conversion): Offers a legal pathway for businesses transitioning from a company structure to an LLP.
• Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999: Regulates foreign investment and partners in LLPs.
• Income Tax Act, 1961: Outlines LLP taxation, deductions, and exemptions.

tabs.title: Key Characteristics of LLP
content: • Limited Liability – Protects partners’ personal assets
• Separate Legal Entity – LLP can own property & sue/be sued
• Perpetual Succession – Unaffected by partner exits or deaths
• Flexible Capital – No minimum capital requirement
• Custom Governance – Rights and duties defined by LLP agreement
• Tax Efficiency – No dividend tax; profits taxed only once
• Fewer Filings – Audit only if turnover exceeds ₹40 lakh or capital exceeds ₹25 lakh
• Unlimited Partners – Add more partners without structural changes

tabs.title: Why Should You Register an LLP?
content: • Limited Liability for all partners
• No double taxation or DDT
• Fewer compliance than companies
• Flexible ownership & profit-sharing
• Suitable for all kinds of business
• Perpetual existence ensures business continuity
• Easy to scale with more partners
• Improves credibility with banks, clients & vendors
• Smooth transfer of ownership

tabs.title: Eligibility for LLP Registration
content: • Minimum 2 partners (individuals or corporate entities)
• At least 2 designated partners (1 must be an Indian resident), designated partners must be individuals
• All partners must be 18+ and legally competent
• Must obtain DSC and DIN/DPIN
• LLP must not operate in restricted or non-profit sectors
• Registered office address required
• Must draft a valid LLP Agreement

tabs.title: Documents Required for LLP Registration
content: Partner Documents:
• PAN Card + Aadhaar/Passport/Voter ID
• Recent passport-size photo
• Valid DSC
• Proof of Indian residency (for one designated partner)
Business Address Documents:
• Utility bill (not older than 2 months)
• NOC from landlord (if rented)
• Rent agreement or property papers
LLP Setup Docs:
• Draft LLP Agreement
• Capital contribution proof
• Professional certifications (if applicable)
• Old business registration (for conversions)
• RUN-LLP form, Form FiLLiP, and Form 3

tabs.title: How to Register an LLP in India?
content: • Get Digital Signature Certificate (DSC)
• Apply for DPIN/DIN
• File RUN-LLP to reserve the business name
• Submit Form FiLLiP with required documents
• Pay government fees & stamp duty
• Receive the LLP incorporation certificate
• Draft, finalize & notarize LLP Agreement
• File Form 3 within 30 days
• Apply for PAN, TAN, and open a bank account
• Proceed with the GST application in India if the turnover is applicable

tabs.title: Registration Fees of LLP Registration
content: Cost Breakdown:
Item | Price Range (₹)
• Name Reservation (RUN-LLP) – ₹200
• Incorporation Fee (Form FiLLiP) – ₹500 to ₹5,000 (based on capital)
• DIN/DPIN – ₹500 per partner
• LLP Agreement Drafting – ₹3,000 to ₹10,000
• Professional Services – ₹6,000 to ₹15,000
• Professional tax enrollment – State-wise rates
• Stamp Duty – 0.1% to 1% of capital (State-wise)
Penalties:
• Late Form 3 filing – ₹100/day (max ₹5,000)
• Delayed Annual Returns (Form 11) – ₹100/day
• Late Accounts (Form 8) – ₹100/day
• Operating unregistered LLP – Legal liability on partners
• False or missing filings – Up to ₹5 lakh fine
• Non-disclosure of partner interest – Up to ₹1 lakh fine

faqs: 1. Is LLP better than a private limited company?
→ Yes, for small to mid-sized businesses seeking flexibility, fewer compliances, and no double taxation, LLP has multiple benefits.
2. Can I register an LLP alone?
→ No. You need at least two partners to form an LLP in India.
3. How long does it take to register an LLP?
→ It usually takes 7–10 working days if all documents are in place.
4. Is LLP suitable for IT businesses?
→ Absolutely. Many tech startups prefer LLP registration for IT services due to scalability and lower costs.
5. What documents are needed for LLP registration?
→ You’ll need PAN, ID proof, address proof of all partners/designated partners, utility bill for office, LLP Agreement, and Form FiLLiP.
6. Do I get a certificate after LLP registration?
→ Yes, the Registrar issues an LLP incorporation certificate, which serves as official proof.

intro: Looking to start a business with your squad? A partnership firm registration online is the simplest, most flexible way to build a legally recognized venture with your trusted partners. Whether you're starting a local business, a service firm, or a small-scale trading unit, getting registered gives your business the edge it needs.

tabs.title: What is Partnership Firm Registration?
content: Partnership firm registration is the legal process of setting up a business under the Indian Partnership Act, 1932 with the Registrar of Firms. It requires a minimum of two partners, with no upper limit, and there’s no need for a minimum capital investment.
Once registered, the firm gains legal recognition, helping it access financial services, resolve disputes, and build trust with clients, banks, and vendors.
Types of Partnership Firms Eligible for Registration:
• General Partnership – All partners share equal rights, responsibilities, and unlimited liability.
• Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) – Offers limited liability with corporate benefits (registered under a different law).
(Note: LLPs are a distinct legal entity governed by the LLP Act, not the Partnership Act.)
Key Features of a Partnership Firm:
• Two or More Partners – At least 2 people must come together to start the business.
• Shared Control – Every partner can make decisions and sign binding contracts.
• Profit & Loss Sharing – Earnings and losses are divided as per the deed.
• Unlimited Liability – Personal assets can be used to settle business debts.
• No Separate Legal Entity – The firm and its partners are seen as one by law.
• Mutual Agreement – The firm is based on trust and the terms defined in the partnership deed registration online.
Purpose of Partnership Firm Registration:
• Build Legal Standing – Enables the firm to sue or be sued.
• Improve Banking Access – Banks prefer registered firms for current accounts and loans.
• Tax Benefits – Enjoy business deductions and simpler filing under the Income Tax Act, 1961.
• Increase Business Trust – Suppliers and clients prefer doing business with legally recognized firms.
• Simplify Asset Ownership – The firm can legally own property in its name.
• Resolve Disputes Effectively – The deed helps settle issues internally or legally.
Laws Governing Partnership Firm Registration in India:
• Indian Partnership Act, 1932 – Main legislation for forming, running, and dissolving a partnership.
• Income Tax Act, 1961 – Governs the firm’s tax obligations and ITR filing (Form ITR-5).
• Goods and Services Tax (GST) Act, 2017 – Applies when the firm crosses the GST threshold.
• Indian Contract Act, 1872 – Ensures the partnership agreement (deed) is legally enforceable.
Regulatory Authorities:
• Registrar of Firms (RoF) – Registers the firm and maintains state-wise records.
• Income Tax Department – Issues PAN and handles tax compliance.
• GST Department – Handles registration and returns for GST-registered firms.
• Local Municipal Authorities – Issue Shop & Establishment registration as per state laws.

tabs.title: Why Should You Register a Partnership?
content: • Legal recognition of the business
• Builds trust with customers and vendors
• Easier access to loans and bank accounts
• Tax benefits and deductions available
• Eligibility for MSME registration support
• Smooth succession planning in the deed

tabs.title: Eligibility for Partnership Registration
content: • Minimum of 2 and maximum of 50 partners
• Partners can be individuals, companies, or LLPs
• All must be legally capable of entering contracts
• Firm must have a lawful business objective
• Must create a valid partnership deed registration online
• All partners must provide identity and address proof
• No partner should be included who is legally disqualified

tabs.title: Documents Required for Partnership Registration
content: Essential Documents:
• Partnership deed (duly signed and notarized)
• PAN cards of all partners
• Aadhaar/passport/voter ID for address proof
• Business address proof (rent deed or ownership proof)
• Passport-size photos of partners
Additional (If Applicable):
• Rent Agreement + NOC from landlord
• Utility bill (electricity/water)
• Bank statements (optional)
The deed must include:
• Partner names and addresses
• Nature and scope of business
• Capital contribution made by each partner
• Loss and Profit-sharing ratio
• Partner rights and responsibilities
• Other understandings which the partners may wish to bring in writing

tabs.title: How to Register a Partnership in India?
content: • Choose a business name that’s unique and compliant
• Draft the partnership deed with all key clauses
• Obtain a PAN for the partnership firm
• Apply to the concerned Registrar of Firms
• Submit deed, documents, and fee to the Registrar
• Receive Certificate of Registration post-approval
• Open a current account in the firm’s name
• Apply for licenses like GST, Shop Act, or other applicable licenses
Want help? We handle the process end-to-end with full legal support.

tabs.title: Fees for Partnership Registration
content: Estimated Costs Breakdown:
• Stamp duty (deed): ₹200 – ₹2,000
• Govt registration fee: ₹200 – ₹1,000
• Name search/reservation: ₹100 – ₹500
• Deed drafting (professional): ₹2,000 – ₹8,000
• Registration assistance: ₹2,000 – ₹10,000
• Firm PAN application: ₹110 – ₹225
• GST Registration (if needed): ₹0 + Professional Fee
Penalties for Non-Compliance:
• Not registering firm: Can’t sue third parties for contractual rights
• ITR non-filing: ₹5,000–₹10,000
• GST late filing: ₹200/day per return
• TDS non-compliance: 1% per month of delay
• No books of accounts: Up to ₹25,000 fine

faqs: 1. Can I register a partnership firm online?
→ Yes, many states allow an online form for partnership registration through their Registrar portals.
2. What is the difference between LLP and a partnership?

→ An LLP offers limited liability and has a separate legal identity, while a partnership does not. LLPs are more structured and legally regulated, whereas partnerships are simpler with fewer formalities.
3. What are the documents required for partnership firm registration?

4. How much do partnership firm registration charges typically cost?

intro: Looking to ensure compliance and secure your employees' retirement benefits? Registering for the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) is mandatory for businesses in India with a workforce of 20 or more. Our online EPF registration service in India is fast, reliable, and fully compliant with EPFO guidelines.

tabs.title: What is EPF Registration?
content: Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) is a mandatory savings scheme for salaried employees in India, offering financial security post-retirement. Both employer and employee typically contribute 12% of the basic salary monthly to this fund. The EPF account grows with interest and is managed by the Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO).
What’s Covered Under EPF Registration?
• EPF (Provident Fund): Monthly retirement savings
• EPS (Pension Scheme): Employer’s portion for post-retirement pension
• EDLI (Insurance Scheme): Life cover linked to EPF account
Laws Governing EPF Registration in India
• Employees’ Provident Funds and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952
• EPF Scheme, 1952
• EPS Scheme, 1995
• EDLI Scheme, 1976

tabs.title: Benefits of Online EPF Registration
content: • Ensures legal compliance and protects your company from EPFO penalties.
• Helps in employee retention by securing their post-retirement savings.
• Offers tax benefits under Section 80C for both employer and employee.
• Provides a quick and paperless EPF registration process for startups.
• Integrates smoothly with ESIC and other payroll compliance tools.
• Enhances your company’s credibility and employer branding.

tabs.title: Eligibility for EPF Registration
content: • Mandatory for businesses with 20 or more employees.
• Voluntary registration allowed for firms with less than 20 employees.
• Applicable to all types of registered businesses: sole proprietorship, partnership, LLP, or company.
• EPF registration is compulsory within 1 month of reaching the employee threshold.
• Employer must have a valid PAN and GST registration.

tabs.title: Documents Required for EPF Registration
content: Employer Documents
• PAN Card of the company/firm
• Certificate of Incorporation or registration
• Address proof of the business
• Cancelled company cheque
• Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) of the employer
• Specimen signature of the employer
Employee Details
• List of employees with joining dates and salary
• Aadhaar and PAN cards
• Bank account details
• Email ID and mobile numbers
Establishment Documents
• GST, MSME, or Shop Act Certificate
• ESIC registration proof (if available)
• Wage and attendance registers
• Board resolution or partner’s consent
• Tax registration copies

tabs.title: How to Register for EPF?
content: • Sign up on the EPFO portal using company details
• Select 'Register as an Employer'
• Upload required documents
• Submit employee and bank details
• Verify via DSC and file the application
• Receive 17-digit EPF code after approval
• Link PAN and GST for deductions
• Start filing monthly PF returns

tabs.title: EPF Registration Fees
content: Cost Breakdown
• Employer DSC: ₹1,000 – ₹2,000
• Registration Filing (EPFO): Free
• Professional Assistance: ₹1,000 – ₹3,000
• Document Preparation: ₹500 – ₹2,000
• Monthly Filing Support: ₹1,500 – ₹5,000/month
• PAN and GST setup: Varies
• Professional Tax Enrollment: State-wise rates
Penalties
• Non-registration after 20 employees: ₹25,000 + ₹500/day
• Late PF return: ₹5/day per employee
• Late contribution: 12% interest + ₹1/day
• Non-enrolment: Legal action + dues recovery

tabs.title: EPF Compliance Requirements
content: Monthly Requirements
• Generate ECR on EPFO portal
• Deposit 12% employer + 12% employee contribution
• Upload employee data and salary details
• Update UAN, Aadhaar, and bank info
• Pay 0.5% administrative charges
Annual/Ongoing
• File Form 5A
• File Form 3A and 6A
• Maintain records of wages and PF payments

points: Thousands of employers trust us for fast, accurate, and affordable online EPF registration service in India.
• Fully digital process with end-to-end legal support.

faqs: 1. How to get EPF code for company?
→ Complete EPF registration on EPFO portal to receive your unique 17-digit establishment code.
2. Who needs to do EPF registration in India?
→ Mandatory for businesses with 20+ employees. Optional for those below threshold.
3. What documents are required?
→ PAN, GST, address proof, cancelled cheque, incorporation certificate, employee list.
4. Is there a government fee?
→ No government fee. Only professional service charges apply.
5. Can EPF be registered voluntarily?
→ Yes, businesses with <20 employees can register with employee consent.

intro: Obtain your State FSSAI License with confidence, legally mandatory for mid‑level food businesses across India. This license, valid for one to five years, ensures your food startup, restaurant, or vendor is fully compliant, trusted by consumers, and ready for growth.
why_choose: Legitimizes operations for ₹12 L–₹20 Cr turnover food businesses
Builds consumer trust with mandated food‐safety standards
Enables market expansion within your state
Avoids penalties, product bans, and legal disruptions
cta: Ready to secure compliance and credibility
who_should_register: Dairy units (up to 50,000 L/day) and slaughterhouses (specified capacity)

types: Basic Registration – For small food businesses with a turnover below ₹12 lakh.
State License – For businesses with turnover between ₹12 lakh and ₹20 crore operating within a state.
Central License – For businesses with a turnover above ₹20 crore or those operating in multiple states.
components: A 14-digit license number linked to your business.
Valid for 1 to 5 years, renewable before expiry.
Specifies business category (e.g., manufacturing, retail, catering).
Must be visibly displayed on packaging and premises.
regulatory_bodies: FSSAI (Central Authority) – Sets food safety regulations, oversees digital registration via FoSCoS.
State Food Safety Department – Verifies documents, conducts inspections, and issues licenses at the state level.

benefits: Improves Consumer Trust – Displays credibility and food safety assurance to consumers and business partners.
Mandatory Legal Compliance – Ensures your food operation is under legal purview and avoids penalties for non-licensed trade.
Simplifies Business Expansion – Enables easier access to tie-ups with retailers, e-commerce platforms, and institutional buyers.
Enhances Export Potential – State-licensed businesses can upgrade to a Central FSSAI license if expanding beyond ₹20 crore or operating interstate.
Access to Government Support – Eligible for subsidies, priority in tenders, and inclusion in food safety initiatives like e-marketplaces.
eligibility: Company turnover must be between ₹12 lakh and ₹20 crore, operating within one state only.
Business types include manufacturers, transporters, distributors, storage units, restaurants, caterers, and hotels.
Must have a production or processing address within the state.
For specific categories like milk or meat products, additional clearances (e.g., animal health dept.) may be required.
The applicant must be a legal entity (owner, partnership, company, or trust) and not prohibited under any food regulations.

faqs.question: Who requires a State FSSAI license?
faqs.answer: Businesses with turnover between ₹12 lakh and ₹20 crore operating within one state, such as hotels, restaurants, manufacturers, caterers, and warehouses.

faqs.question: Can I operate in two states with a State FSSAI license?
faqs.answer: No, a State license is valid only within the issuing state. If expanding interstate, you must apply for a Central FSSAI license.

faqs.question: What documents are needed for renewal?
faqs.answer: Renewal typically requires submission of the current license copy, updated compliance statements, and renewal fee payment.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a State FSSAI license?
faqs.answer: Most states process applications within 30–60 days. Timelines depend on document completeness and inspection schedules.

faqs.question: Is displaying the license mandatory?
faqs.answer: Yes, the license number must be displayed on food packaging, menus, and shop premises, non-display attracts fines.

faqs.question: What happens if I violate FSSAI norms?
faqs.answer: Non-compliance may lead to substantial fines per offence, suspension, or cancellation of the license depending on violation severity.

intro: Planning to take your business worldwide? Whether you're a trader, startup, or manufacturer, Import Export Code Registration in India is the first mandatory step to legally import or export goods and services.

tabs.title: What is Import Export Code (IEC)?
content: The IEC (Importer Exporter Code) is a 10-digit business identification number issued by DGFT. It's mandatory for individuals or businesses looking to conduct import/export operations in India. Once allotted, it is valid for the lifetime of the entity and doesn’t require renewal.
Types of Entities That Can Apply for IEC:
• Sole Proprietorships
• Private Limited Companies
• Partnership Firms
• LLPs
• Trusts & Societies
• Government Undertakings
Components of IEC Code:
• 10-digit alphanumeric code (based on your PAN)
• Linked GST and business details
• Validity across all India
• Issued by DGFT
Laws Governing IEC Registration:
• Foreign Trade (Development & Regulation) Act, 1992
• Current Foreign Trade Policy (2023)
• DGFT guidelines for digital registration and modification
• Customs Act, 1962 (for international trade)

tabs.title: Benefits of IEC Code
content: • Enables legal import/export of goods and services
• Required by customs and shipping agencies
• IEC is permanent, thus no renewal hassles
• Helps in availing export incentives from DGFT or Customs
• Enhances credibility with international clients
• Required for APEDA licensing and central FSSAI license
• Links directly to bank and PAN accounts for verification
• Simplifies global trade documentation and customs clearance

tabs.title: Eligibility for IEC Registration
content: • Valid PAN and business address in India
• Individual, company, LLP, or firm planning imports or exports
• Current account with a bank in India
• Completed GST registration (if applicable)
• No minimum turnover required

tabs.title: IEC Registration Scenarios
content: Mandatory Registration:
• For exporting/importing goods or services
• Claiming export benefits from DGFT
• Registering with APEDA, FSSAI, or customs
• Using eCommerce platforms for international trade
Voluntary Registration:
• Freelancers serving overseas clients

tabs.title: What is Udyam (MSME) Registration?
content: Udyam registration (formerly Udyog Aadhaar) is a government-issued certification for Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) under the Ministry of MSME. It helps businesses access financial, legal, and policy support.
Types of MSMEs (Based on Classification)
• Micro: Investment ≤ ₹2.5 Cr & Turnover ≤ ₹10 Cr
• Small: Investment ≤ ₹25 Cr & Turnover ≤ ₹100 Cr
• Medium: Investment ≤ ₹125 Cr & Turnover ≤ ₹500 Cr
Core Components of Udyam Registration

• PAN and GST linking (if applicable)
• Unique 19-digit Udyam Registration Number (URN)

Regulatory Framework

intro: Looking to ensure compliance while expanding your business in India? Professional Tax Registration Online is a mandatory registration for employers and self-employed professionals in states that impose professional tax. A timely setup ensures legal compliance, helps in payroll structuring, and enhances your organisation's credibility.

tabs.title: What is Professional Tax ?
content: Professional Tax (PT) is a state-imposed tax on income from salaries and professional earnings. It's governed under various state-specific PT Acts, such as Maharashtra’s Professional Tax Act or Karnataka’s KTPT Act. Employers deduct PT each month and remit it to the government authorities.
Schemes Covered:
• Employer Registration – Required when you hire employees in PT states
• Self/Professional Registration – For individuals earning from professional activity
You must register within 30 days of hiring staff, or if you voluntarily opt in below the mandated employee limits.
Types of Professional Tax
• Employer registration – For organizations deducting PT from employees
• Self-employed registration – For individuals like freelancers or consultants
• Occupation-based categorization – Some states specify different fees for CA, medical practitioners, architects, etc.
Rules and Regulations
• State-based, each following its own PT Act
• Must register within 30 days of employing staff
• Deduction deadline: typically the 15th of each month
• Slab-wise deduction depending on salary or occupation
• Annual cap often around ₹2,500 per employee
• Requires PT certificate after successful registration
Applicable for Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Punjab, and many others, except Delhi, Goa, Haryana, etc.
Features of Professional Tax
• State Specific – Laws, slabs, and compliances vary by state
• Mandatory Deduction – Employers must deduct and remit PT
• Slab-based – Income slabs or profession-based flat rates
• Annual Capped Amount – Usually ₹2,500 for salaried individuals
• Penalty Mechanism – Penalties vary based on delay or defaults

tabs.title: Benefits of Professional Tax Registration
content: • Ensures your business complies with LLP and company obligations, especially for payroll and employee tax management.
• Improves your brand's trust with banks, investors, and government authorities during financial evaluations.
• Boosts employee confidence by showcasing structured and lawful employee compliance in India.
• Enables tax savings as the professional tax amount is fully deductible under the Income Tax Act.
• Helps secure tenders, licenses, and approvals requiring PT registration, such as shop establishment certificates.
• Streamlines documentation for PAN, TAN, and GST formalities, reducing errors and rejections.
• Aids in smooth hiring and onboarding, particularly in PT-compliant states like Maharashtra and Karnataka.
• Keeps your organization protected from notices, fines, and audits due to non-compliance.
• Adds to legal transparency, which is essential for MSMEs applying for loans or subsidies.
• Required for businesses availing benefits under schemes like online MSME registration or Startup India.
• Useful for registering e-commerce or gig workers on platforms that ask for a professional tax status.
• Useful for registering e-commerce or gig workers on platforms that ask for a professional tax status.
• Acts as a compliance credential when expanding operations into multiple PT-mandated states.

tabs.title: Eligibility for Professional Tax Registration
content: • Employers must register if they employ 20+ individuals in PT-applicable states
• Self-employed professionals must register if practicing in PT-applicable states
• Applicable to all business forms: proprietary, partnership, LLP, company
• PT-applicable states include Maharashtra, Karnataka, West Bengal, etc.
• States like Delhi, Haryana, and Goa do not currently impose PT
• Employer must start enrollment within one month of meeting the criteria

tabs.title: Documents Required Professional Tax Registration
content: Employer / Business Registration
• PAN Card of the entity
• Certificate of Incorporation or Shop License
• Registered business address proof (utility bill/rent agreement)

• Details of employees (salary, joining date)

Self-employed / Professional Registration
• PAN and Aadhaar
• Address proof (electricity bill or passport)

tabs.title: Professional Tax Registration Process
content: • Confirm State Applicability – Check if PT applies in your operational state
• Gather Documents – Employer and self-employed categories require specific documents
• Complete Online Application – Through the state PT portal (Maharashtra MST/Bengal WPTO/EPS)
• Upload Attachments – PAN, address, employee list, board resolution
• Authority Verification – Desk level verification or field inspection if applicable
• Receive Registration Certificate – Usually within  4–7  working days
• Start Regular Compliance – Monthly filings and payments thereafter

tabs.title: Fees & Penalties for Professional Tax Registration
content: Cost Breakdown
• PT Application Fee: ₹100 – ₹500 (state-wise)
• Certificate Charges (Printed Copy): ₹200 – ₹1,000
• Professional Assistance: ₹999 – ₹5,000 one-time
Penalty Structure
• Late Registration: ₹5 – ₹20 per day
• Late Monthly Payment: 1.25% – 2% monthly interest
• False Information Submission: Up to ₹5,000 fine
• Late Return Filing: ₹1,000 per month
State regulations often vary, always verify for Maharashtra, Gujarat, Karnataka, etc.

tabs.title: Compliance Requirements
content: Monthly Tasks
• Deduct PT from salaries by the 15th
• Deposit PT with the government authorities by the due date
• File monthly/quarterly PT returns (varies by state)
On Occasion
• Reconcile the employee list and salary slabs annually
• Renew or update the PT certificate when required
Update employee count and salary details with the municipal bodies
Stay updated with changes to the professional tax slab in India via state notifications
Annual Compliance Requirements
• File employee registration annually (varies by state)
• Update spousal or nominee details if applicable
• Submit annual salary reconciliation and slab variation details
• Pay any additional tax considering full-year slabs
• Renew the certificate if suggested by the local PT department

whyChooseUs.heading: Why Choose Registering With Us for Professional Tax Registration?
points: When you choose us, you’re entrusting your professional tax compliance to a team that treats every step as mission-critical. We make PT registration online easy, reliable, and tailored to your business:
• Expert guidance on LLP and company obligations
• State-aware solutions with slab monitoring and document checks
• Transparent plans, with no hidden costs for add-ons

faqs: 1. Is professional tax mandatory for a solo freelancer?

→ Yes, in states where professional tax is applicable, freelancers, consultants, and independent professionals are required to register and pay based on state-specific income slabs. Non-compliance could lead to penalties even if you're not a traditional employer.
2. How is professional tax different from income tax?

→ Professional tax is a state-level tax levied on income from profession, trade, or employment, while income tax is levied by the central government on total annual income. PT is paid monthly or annually, and it’s deductible while calculating your income tax liability.
3. Can PT registration be done online?

→ Yes, most states like Maharashtra, Karnataka, and West Bengal offer full online registration portals for PT. You can upload documents, track status, and receive certificates digitally without visiting any government office.
4. What are the consequences of not deducting professional tax?

→ Employers who fail to deduct and remit PT can face monetary fines, interest, and legal action under state laws. In some cases, it can even affect your eligibility for licenses or renewals from government departments.
5. How can I stay updated on PT slab changes?

→ You can regularly check your respective state’s commercial taxes department or subscribe to government gazettes. Platforms like Register With Us also keep businesses informed with automated compliance alerts and updates.
6. Does PT registration impact PAN or TAN?

→ While PT is governed separately by state authorities, being compliant with it helps streamline your PAN, TAN, and GST setup and avoids rejection during statutory checks. It’s especially important when you’re about to register a private limited company, as professional tax compliance is often required for business registration formalities.

intro: Private limited company registration online lets you incorporate under the Companies Act, 2013, creating a distinct legal entity, protecting personal assets, and enabling equity funding.

tabs.title: What is Private Limited Company Registration?
content: Private limited company registration is the process of legally incorporating your business under the Companies Act, 2013. It creates a separate legal identity for your business, meaning it can own property, enter into contracts, and be held accountable independently of its owners.

This structure limits the personal liability of shareholders, making it a preferred choice for startups, growing businesses, and entrepreneurs who want credibility, scalability, and legal protection. Once registered, the company receives a Certificate of Incorporation and a unique CIN (Corporate Identification Number).
Types of Private Limited Companies:-
Company Limited by Shares: Most common; shareholders are liable only up to unpaid share value.
Company Limited by Guarantee: Usually for non-profits; members guarantee a specific amount on dissolution.
Unlimited Company: Members have full liability but benefit from separate legal status.
Objectives of Registering a Private Limited Company:-
Establish a legally recognized business identity.
Protect personal assets from business liabilities.
Raise capital through private investors.
Maintain business continuity regardless of ownership changes.
Access schemes like startup India benefits and other incentives.
Laws Governing Private Limited Company Registration:-
Companies Act, 2013 – Main law for company incorporation and governance.
Income Tax Act, 1961 – Regulates corporate tax filing and deductions.
GST Laws – Requires GST registration for new companies above certain turnover limits.
FEMA – Controls foreign investments in Indian companies.
IT Act, 2000 – Applies to digital and e-commerce businesses.
Regulatory Authorities:-
Registrar of Companies (ROC): Approves incorporation and issues registration documents.
Income Tax Department: For PAN, TAN, and tax filings.
RBI: Governs foreign investments under FEMA.
SEBI: Applies only if issuing public securities or planning a listing.

tabs.title: Characteristics of Private Limited Company Registration
content: • Distinct Legal Entity: A private limited company is treated as a separate legal entity from its shareholders, allowing it to own property, enter into contracts, and sue or be sued independently.
• Limited Liability: Shareholders are only liable up to the amount they invested in the company; their personal assets are protected from business losses or debts.
• Perpetual Succession: The company continues to exist even if shareholders or directors change due to death, resignation, or transfer of shares.
• Separate Management & Ownership: Shareholders own the company, while directors are responsible for managing daily operations, creating clear accountability.
• Ability to Raise Equity Capital: The company can issue shares to raise funds from investors, including venture capitalists, private equity firms, or angel investors.

tabs.title: Benefits of Private Limited Company Registration
content: • Why Should You Register a Private Limited Company?
• Enhanced Credibility: Builds trust with stakeholders.
• Access to Funding: Preferred by banks and investors.
• Tax Advantages: Corporate deductions and incentives.
• Brand Protection: Secure your brand name trademark.
• Scalability: Ideal for high-growth ventures.
• Global Expansion: Easier joint ventures and overseas entry.
• Ownership Transfer: Share transfers with minimal hurdles.

tabs.title: Eligibility for Private Limited Company Registration
content: Eligibility for a Private Limited Company
• Minimum Directors: At least 2 directors are required to register a private limited company.
• Director Residency: At least 1 director must be a resident of India (182+ days in the previous year).
• Maximum Directors: Up to 15 directors allowed by default (more via passing special resolution).
• Minimum Shareholders: A minimum of 2 shareholders is mandatory (can also be directors).
• Maximum Shareholders: Maximum 200 shareholders, excluding employee shareholders.
• Registered Office: Must have a physical address in India for official communication.
• Share Capital: No minimum capital required, but authorized capital must be declared.
• DIN: All directors must hold a valid Director Identification Number (DIN).
• DSC: A Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) is needed for each director.

tabs.title: Documents Required Private Limited Company Registration
content: Documents Required for Private Limited Company Registration
To complete your Private Limited Company Registration online in India, you’ll need the following documents
1. For Directors and Shareholders:
• PAN Card
• Aadhar Card (for Indian nationals)
• Recent passport-sized photographs
• Residential Utility bills as address proof (not older than two months)
• Personal Bank statement (not older than two months)
• Passport copy (for foreign nationals/NRIs)
• Driver's license or Voter ID card
• Mobile number linked with Aadhaar
• Email ID
2. For Foreign Directors/Shareholders (Additional):
• Copy of passport with visa details
• Address proof from the home country
• Bank statement from the home country
• Notarized and apostilled documents as per country requirements
3. For Registered Office:
• Proof of registered office address (utility bill, property tax receipt)
• NOC from the property owner if the premises are rented/leased
• Rent/lease agreement copy
• Recent electricity bill (not older than 2 months) or property tax receipt
4. Company-Related Documents:
Proposed company name options (3-4 alternatives), maximum two names can be applied in single application.
Description of business activities and objectives
Details of authorized and paid-up capital
Shareholding pattern
Draft Memorandum of Association (MOA)
Draft Articles of Association (AOA)
Resolution appointing the first directors

tabs.title: How to Register a Private Limited Company?
content: Step 1: Obtain DSCs for all directors.
Step 2: Reserve the company name through the RUN service.
Step 3: Acquire DINs via SPICe+ form.
Step 4: Prepare and sign the MOA, AOA, and consents.
Step 5: File SPICe+ with attachments; pay fees & stamp duty.
Step 6: Receive Certificate of Incorporation and CIN.
Step 7: Apply for PAN, TAN, and register for professional tax enrollment.
Step 8: Open a current bank account in the company’s name.
Step 9: Apply for obtaining certificate of commencement of business of the Company

tabs.title: Registration Fees of a Private Limited Company Registration
content: • Name Reservation (RUN): 1,000
• SPICe+ Filing (≤₹1 Lakh capital): ₹5,000
• Additional Capital Fee (>₹1 Lakh): ₹0.01% of excess
• Stamp Duty: ₹1,000–₹10,000 (state-dependent)
• DSC per Director: ₹1,000–₹2,000
• Professional Service Charges: ₹5,000–₹12,000
• Company Seal & Stationery: ₹500–₹1,500
State regulations often vary, always verify for Maharashtra, Gujarat, Karnataka, etc.

tabs.title: Compliance Requirements
content: Annual Return (MGT-7) within 60 days of AGM.
Financial Statements (AOC-4) within 30 days of AGM.
Minimum of four board meetings per year.
Maintain statutory registers and minutes.
File annual ITR; pay quarterly advance tax.
File GST returns if applicable.
Deduct and deposit TDS; file quarterly returns.

faqs: 1. Can I register a private limited company online?
→ Yes, you can register a private limited company online via SPICe+ on the MCA portal. The entire process is paperless and can be done from anywhere in India. Register With us assist you at each step
2. What are the minimum directors required for a pvt  ltd company?
→ A minimum of two directors is required, with at least one being a resident of India. This ensures the company has proper local representation as per Indian laws.
3. How long does the online company incorporation process take?
→ It typically takes 10–15 working days, subject to document accuracy and approvals. Faster processing is possible if all required documents are submitted correctly.
4. What documents for pvt ltd company registration?
→ You need PAN, address proof, MOA, AOA, director consents, office proof, and DSCs. Each document must be valid, current, and consistent with government records.
5. What are the benefits of pvt ltd company registration?
→ Key benefits of pvt ltd company registration include limited liability, funding access, and credibility. It’s also the most preferred structure for startups and scalable businesses.
6.  Is OPC better than a private limited company?
→ An OPC suits solo entrepreneurs but lacks the investor appeal and scalability of a Pvt Ltd company. Private Limited Companies are more flexible when it comes to ownership and growth.

intro: Looking to scale your business nationally or go public? Public limited company registration in India offers unmatched access to capital, investor trust, and nationwide visibility. Registering a Public Limited Company helps you raise funds from the public, list on the stock exchange, and comply with SEBI standards, all with limited liability.

tabs.title: Why choose a Public Limited Company?
content: Ability to raise funds from public investors via offering its shares
Separate legal identity offering limited liability
Listed (or unlisted) companies can scale operations with ease
Enhanced transparency attracts investors and regulatory trust
Ready to become a publicly registered company with nationwide authority? We’re here to help you every step of the way.
CTA - Get Started with Your Public Limited Company Registration

tabs.title: Who Should Register a Public Limited Company?
content: Public limited company registration is ideal for entrepreneurs and enterprises looking to raise public funds, expand globally, and attract institutional investors.
Perfect for:
Large businesses planning IPO or public fundraising
Firms looking for global visibility and investor trust
Startups aiming to go public in the long run
Companies in sectors that require heavy capital investments
Businesses ready to comply with SEBI and stock exchange rules

tabs.title: What is a Public Limited Company?
content: A Public Limited Company (PLC) is a business entity that allows its shares to be traded by the general public on stock exchanges. Governed by the Companies Act, 2013, it enables easy access to capital, limited liability for shareholders, and public ownership for expansion and credibility.
Types of Public Limited Companies
Listed Public Company: Shares are listed on stock exchanges (e.g., BSE, NSE) and open to public trading.
Unlisted Public Company: Not listed but can still raise funds from the public via private placements or public offers.

tabs.title: Key Features of a PLC
content: Limited Liability: Shareholders are only liable up to their shareholding (unpaid amount).
Separate Legal Entity: Can own assets, sue, and be sued independently.
Free Share Transferability: Shares can be easily sold or bought in the open market.
Board-Driven Management: Run by a board of directors accountable to shareholders.
Minimum Members: Minimum 7 members and 3 directors.
No Cap on Shareholders: There is no bar on number of shareholders

tabs.title: Acts & Regulations Governing PLCs
content: 1. Companies Act, 2013: Covers incorporation, share issuance, management, filings, and winding up.
2. SEBI Regulations (if listed): SEBI (LODR) for corporate governance and disclosures. SEBI (ICDR) for IPO regulations. Insider Trading, Takeover, and Depository rules.
3. Income Tax Act, 1961: Regulates corporate taxes, TDS, and ITR filing.
4. GST Laws: Apply if turnover exceeds the threshold for GST registration.
5. Labour Laws: Mandatory ESICs, PF, gratuity, wage compliance, etc.

tabs.title: Minimum Requirements for Public Limited Company Registration
content: Minimum Shareholders: 7 individuals or entities.
Minimum Directors: 3 (at least one must be a resident of India).
Paid-Up Capital: No minimum mandated post-2015 amendment.
DIN & DSC: Mandatory for all directors.
Company Name: Must end with “Limited” or “Ltd.”

tabs.title: Difference Between Public Limited Company and Private Limited Company
content: Feature | Public Limited Company (PLC) | Private Limited Company (Pvt Ltd)
Minimum Members | 7 | 2
Maximum Members | No upper limit | 200 (excluding employee shareholders)
Minimum Directors | 3 | 2
Share Transferability | Freely transferable via stock exchange | Restricted by Articles of Association
Public Fundraising | Can invite the public via IPO/prospectus | Cannot raise capital from the public
Listing Eligibility | Can be listed on stock exchanges | Cannot be listed
Regulatory Compliance | High (SEBI, as applicable + MCA compliance) | Moderate (MCA compliance only)
Capital Raising Scope | High (via public, FPOs, institutions) | Limited to private investors & loans
Transparency | Mandatory public disclosure of financials | No mandatory public disclosure
Suitability | Large businesses with growth capital needs | SMEs, startups, and family businesses

tabs.title: Benefits of Public Limited Company Registration
content: Registering a public limited company in India offers unparalleled benefits for businesses seeking rapid growth and expansion.
Raise Public Capital: Access large-scale funding by issuing shares and debentures on stock exchanges.
Limited Liability: Shareholders’ personal assets are protected against company debts.
Greater Visibility: Public listing increases brand exposure and trust.
Share Liquidity: Shares can be easily transferred or sold in open markets.
Investor Trust: Mandatory and timely disclosures build confidence among banks, investors and the public.
Scalability: Ideal structure for ambitious expansions and long-term projects.
Perpetual Existence: Company continues regardless of change in shareholders or Directors.

tabs.title: Registration Fees
content: Public limited company registration fees vary by capital and state:
Component | Cost (₹)
Name Reservation | 1,000
Govt. Fees (SPICe+) | ~5,000 for ≤₹1 L capital; can go up to ₹20,000–50,000 based on authorized capital
Stamp Duty | 0.1%–0.2% of capital, varying by state
Professional Services | 5,000 – 15,000
Digital Signature (per director) | ₹1,500– 2,500 per director
Director Identification Number | ₹500 per director

tabs.title: Penalties for Non-Compliance
content: Late filing: ₹100/day per form
Non-disclosure of interests: up to ₹1 lakh
ROC filing delays: ₹5,000 to ₹25,000+
Regulatory non-adherence (SEBI, MCA): strict financial and legal penalties

tabs.title: How to Register a Public Limited Company in India?
content: Get Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) for all proposed directors
Apply for Director Identification Number (DIN)
Reserve your company name via the RUN service
Draft and finalize MOA & AOA
File the SPICe+ form with all required documents
Pay government registration fees and applicable stamp duty
Receive the Certificate of Incorporation with your CIN
Apply for company PAN and TAN
Open a business current account
Apply for obtaining certificate of commencement of business of the Company
Complete mandatory tax registrations like ESIC for large businesses and GST registration for new companies (if applicable)

tabs.title: Documents Required for Public Limited Company Registration
content: 1. For Shareholders & Directors:
PAN card, Aadhaar, or passport
Residential address proof like mobile bill, bank statement, electricity bill etc (not later than 2 months)
Passport-size photos
Valid DSCs
2. For Registered Office:
Recent utility bill (within 2 months)
NOC or rent agreement from the landlord
3. Company Documents:
Proposed names
MoA and AoA
Digital sign and DIN application forms

tabs.title: Compliance Checklist
content: Board Meeting: Hold within 30 days of incorporation.
Appoint Auditor: Within 30 days, as per Section 139.
Open Bank Account: Submit incorporation documents and PAN.
Director Disclosure: Submit interest declaration in Form MBP-1/ DIR-8.
Register Office Setup: Intimate ROC with address in 30 days.
Issue Share Certificates: Within 60 days to subscribers.
Commencement Certificate: File INC-20A within 180 days.
Maintain Registers: Per company law (members, charges, etc.).
Display Details: Name plate at office, official stationery with CIN.
Setup Books of Accounts: Double-entry, accrual system required.

tabs.title: Annual Compliances as per Companies Act, 2013
content: File annual return and financial statements with ROC (Form AOC-4 / AOC-4 XBRL, MGT-7 / MGT-8)
Complete DIR-3 KYC for all directors
Hold AGMs and maintain statutory registers
Ensure regular updates to shareholding and board composition
Return of Deposits (Form DPT-3)
Form MSME-1

whyChooseUs.heading: Why Choose Register with Us?
points: Register with Us simplifies public limited company registration online with expertise, accuracy, and transparency.
Trusted by 10,000+ Indian entrepreneurs
Experts in SEBI compliance for public companies
Transparent pricing, no hidden fees
Full support from application to post-incorporation
Guidance on MSME classification in India, ESIC, and mandatory tax registrations

faqs: 1. How to register a public limited company in India?
→ Registration is done online through the MCA portal using SPICe+ and e-forms. We assist you from start to finish with 100% compliance.
2. What are the requirements for public limited company registration?
→ You need 7 shareholders, 3 directors, DSC, DIN, office address, and a unique name.
3. What are the pros and cons of a public limited company?
→ Pros: High capital access, limited liability, and strong brand trust. Cons: More and complex compliances/regulations.
4. What’s the role of SEBI in public companies?
→ SEBI regulates IPOs, investor protection, disclosures, and insider trading. This is applicable only if the company is listed on a stock exchange.
5. Do I need to renew a public limited company registration?
→ No, but you must file annual returns and comply with ongoing obligations. Non-compliance may lead to penalties or strike-off.

intro: Looking to ensure compliance and secure your employees' retirement benefits? Registering for the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) is mandatory for businesses in India with a workforce of 20 or more. Our online EPF registration service in India is fast, reliable, and fully compliant with EPFO guidelines.

tabs.title: What is EPF?
content: Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) is a mandatory savings scheme for salaried employees in India, offering financial security post-retirement.
Both employer and employee typically contribute 12% of the basic salary monthly to this fund.
The EPF account grows with interest and is managed by the Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO).
Registering under employees provident fund registration ensures legal compliance and long-term benefits for your workforce.

tabs.title: What’s Covered Under EPF Registration?
content: • EPF (Provident Fund): Monthly retirement savings
• EPS (Pension Scheme): Employer’s portion for post-retirement pension
• EDLI (Insurance Scheme): Life cover linked to EPF account
These are bundled automatically once you receive your EPF code for the company.

tabs.title: Laws Governing EPF Registration in India
content: • Employees’ Provident Funds and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952: The primary legislation mandating provident fund contributions from eligible employers.
• EPF Scheme, 1952: Defines the working, contributions, withdrawals, and benefits.
• EPS Scheme, 1995: Covers employee pension eligibility and rules.
• EDLI Scheme, 1976: Offers insurance coverage linked to EPF enrollment.

tabs.title: Benefits of Online EPF Registration in India
content: • Ensures legal compliance and protects your company from EPFO penalties.
• Helps in employee retention by securing their post-retirement savings.
• Offers tax benefits under Section 80C for both employer and employee.
• Provides a quick and paperless EPF registration process for startups.
• Integrates smoothly with ESIC and other payroll compliance tools.
• Enhances your company’s credibility and employer branding.

tabs.title: Eligibility for Online EPF Registration in India
content: • Mandatory for businesses with 20 or more employees.
• Voluntary registration allowed for firms with less than 20 employees.
• Applicable to all types of registered businesses: sole proprietorship, partnership, LLP, or company.
• EPF registration for employers is compulsory within 1 month of reaching the employee threshold.
• Startups must check PF registration applicability in India based on workforce strength and wage structure.
• Employer must have a valid PAN and GST registration.

tabs.title: Documents Required for EPF Registration
content: Employer Documents:
• PAN Card of the company/firm
• Certificate of Incorporation or registration
• Address proof of the business (electricity bill, lease deed, etc.)
• Cancelled company cheque with printed account details
• Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) of the employer
• Specimen signature of the employer (with stamp/seal)
Employee Documents:
• List of all employees with joining dates and salary details
• Aadhaar and PAN cards of employees
• Bank account details of employees
• Email ID and mobile numbers of employees
Establishment Documents:
• Registration/license proof (GST, MSME, or Shops & Establishment certificate)
• Proof of ESIC registration for employees (if already registered)
• Wage register and attendance register
• Board resolution or partner’s consent (for partnerships/LLPs)
• Copy of tax registration or PAN and GST formalities for startups

tabs.title: How to Get EPF Code for Company?
content: Step 1: Sign up on the EPFO portal using company details.
Step 2: Select 'Register as an Employer'.
Step 3: Upload required documents for EPF registration.
Step 4: Submit employee and bank details.
Step 5: Verify using DSC and file the application.
Step 6: Receive 17-digit EPF code for the company after approval.
Step 7: Link company PAN and GST details for tax deduction under PT.
Step 8: Start filing monthly PF returns as per EPFO rules.

tabs.title: EPF Registration Fees in India
content: • Employer DSC: ₹1,000 – ₹2,000
• Registration Filing (online EPFO): Free
• Professional Assistance Charges: ₹1,000 – ₹3,000
• Document Preparation & Upload: ₹500 – ₹2,000
• Monthly PF Filing Support (optional): ₹1,500 – ₹5,000/month
• PAN and GST formalities: Varies by service provider
• Professional tax enrollment: State-wise rates

tabs.title: Penalties for Non-Compliance
content: • Non-registration after crossing threshold: ₹25,000 + ₹500/day (as per EPFO norms).
• Late monthly PF return filing: ₹5/day per employee (cumulative).
• False info during EPF employer registration: ₹5,000 – ₹50,000.
• Delayed payment of contributions: 12% interest annually + ₹1/day per employee.
• Non-enrolment of eligible employees: Legal action + recovery of dues.

tabs.title: EPF Compliance Requirements for Employers
content: Monthly Employer Responsibilities:
• Generate ECR (Electronic Challan-cum-Return) through the EPFO portal.
• Deposit PF contributions by the 15th of each month (12% employer + 12% employee).
• Upload salary and contribution data for all eligible employees.
• Update UANs of new employees and link Aadhaar and bank details.
• Pay administrative charges (0.5% of wages).
Annual & Occasional Compliances:
• Form 5A filing – Declare company structure and responsible signatories.
• Form 3A – Annual contribution card per employee.
• Form 6A – Annual consolidated statement.
• Maintain employee-wise records of wages, deductions, and PF payments.

points: Thousands of employers trust us for fast, accurate, and affordable online EPF registration service in India.

faqs: 1. How to get EPF code for company?
→ You can get your EPF establishment code after completing employer PF registration online on the EPFO unified portal. It serves as your company’s PF identity for all filings.
2. Who needs to do EPF registration in India?
→ All businesses with 20 or more employees must register under the Employees Provident Fund Act. Voluntary registration is also allowed for companies with fewer employees.
3. What documents are needed for EPF employer registration?
→ You’ll need PAN, GST, address proof, cancelled cheque, and authorized signatory documents. Also prepare incorporation proof and employee count list.
4. Is there any fee for EPF employer registration online?
→ No, EPFO doesn’t charge for registration. However, you may pay professional service fees if you're using a consultant to handle the registration.
5. What’s the penalty for non-registration of PF?
→ If you don’t register even after crossing 20 employees, you face up to ₹5,000 in fines per employee, plus interest at 12% and legal prosecution.
6. Can EPF be registered voluntarily by small companies?
→ Yes. Even with fewer than 20 employees, a business can opt in for EPF by mutual agreement with its employees. It improves retention and benefits credibility.

intro: Want to ensure employee security and legal compliance under Indian labor law? ESIC registration online in India is a must for businesses with 10 or more employees. It helps provide medical, disability, maternity, and other benefits through the Employee State Insurance Corporation (ESIC).

tabs.title: Who Needs ESIC Registration?
content: ESI online registration is legally required for most businesses once they cross a certain employee threshold. It also benefits startups and growing businesses.
Ideal for:
• Small to mid-size enterprises hiring 10+ employees
• Startups registering under startup hiring regulations
• IT & tech firms offering salary under ₹21,000
• Retailers and service providers under shops and establishment license
• Manufacturers, construction companies, and healthcare clinics

tabs.title: What is ESIC?
content: The Employees’ State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) is a statutory body under the Ministry of Labour, offering medical, maternity, disability, and dependent benefits to employees.
The scheme is funded by contributions from both employer and employee.
Employer Contribution: 3.25% of wages
Employee Contribution: 0.75% of wages
Coverage: Healthcare, sick leave, maternity, disability compensation
Registering with ESIC ensures protection for both your workforce and your business.

tabs.title: Laws Governing ESIC Registration
content: • The Employees’ State Insurance Act, 1948: The main Act that mandates ESI contributions, eligibility, and entitlements.
• The Code on Social Security, 2020: Will eventually subsume and consolidate ESIC laws (notified but not yet enforced everywhere).
• ESIC Regulations, 1950: Operational rules covering registration, return filing, inspections, and contributions.
• Minimum Wages Act, 1948: Indirectly affects ESI applicability through salary thresholds.
• Factories Act, 1948: Applies ESIC to factory employees.
• Shops and Establishment Acts (State-wise): Used to determine eligibility in commercial sectors.

tabs.title: Regulatory Bodies Responsible for ESIC
content: • Employees’ State Insurance Corporation (ESIC): The central authority that governs the ESI Act and monitors implementation across India.
• Regional and Sub-Regional ESIC Offices: Handle local registrations, inspections, returns, and contribution tracking.
• Ministry of Labour and Employment: Responsible for policy-making and supervision of ESIC.
• ESIC Hospitals and Dispensaries: Deliver direct medical services to insured employees and their family members.
• Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO): A separate authority, often works in coordination with ESIC.

tabs.title: Benefits of Online ESIC Registration
content: • Compliance Assurance: Avoid fines and ensure you're legally covered.
• Healthcare Benefits: Free medical treatment at ESIC hospitals.
• Maternity & Sick Leave: Paid leave during medical emergencies.
• Disability Coverage: Insurance for work-related accidents.
• Employee Trust: Boosts morale and workplace satisfaction.
• Digital Registration: Paperless, fast, and easy process.
• Integrated Setup: Works with EPF, LLP/Pvt Ltd registration, and payroll tools.

tabs.title: Eligibility for ESIC Registration for Employers
content: • Minimum 10 employees earning ≤ ₹21,000/month.
• Businesses must be registered under the Shops and Establishment License or relevant labor law.
• Applicable to factories, commercial setups, and service firms.
• Employer must have PAN, GST, and a valid address.
• Includes industries such as IT, healthcare, food, and education.

tabs.title: Documents Required for ESIC Registration
content: Employer Documents:
• PAN Card of the business
• GST registration certificate
• Address proof of business (utility bill or lease deed)
• License copy (e.g., shops and establishment license)
• Cancelled company cheque
• Digital Signature Certificate of the employer
Employee Details:
• Name, DOB, and Aadhaar of employees
• Salary structure
• Joining date and designation
• Bank account details of each employee
Business Setup Proof:
• Certificate of incorporation or registration
• MOA/AOA or Partnership Deed
• Board resolution (for companies)
• Payroll summary or wage register

tabs.title: How to Register Under ESIC?
content: Step 1: Sign up on the official ESIC portal and generate employer login credentials.
Step 2: Select 'New Employer Registration' and choose establishment type.
Step 3: Fill in company details (PAN, address, date of commencement).
Step 4: Upload required documents (PAN, GST, address proof, employee data).
Step 5: Submit employee details such as Aadhaar, bank info, salary, joining date.
Step 6: Verify digitally using registered DSC.
Step 7: Receive 17-digit ESIC employer code upon approval.
Step 8: Link establishment with shops & establishment license if applicable.
Step 9: Start monthly contribution filings as per ESIC compliance rules.

tabs.title: ESIC Registration Fees
content: • Employer DSC: ₹1,000 – ₹2,000
• Online ESI Registration Filing: Free
• Professional Assistance Charges: ₹3,000 – ₹6,000
• Document Preparation: ₹1,000 – ₹2,000
• Monthly ESI Filing (Optional): ₹1,000 – ₹4,000/month
• PAN and GST formalities: As per provider

tabs.title: Penalties for Non-Compliance
content: • Failure to register: ₹25,000 + possible prosecution.
• Delay in monthly ESI filing: ₹100/day + interest.
• Underreporting of wages or staff: ₹5,000 – ₹50,000.
• Non-payment of contributions: 12% annual interest + damages.
• False declarations: Legal action + penalty up to ₹1 lakh.

tabs.title: Ongoing Compliance After Registration
content: Monthly Responsibilities:
• Deposit contributions before 15th of each month.
• File employee-wise returns online.
• Update new employee data and link Aadhaar.
Annual Duties:
• Maintain register of wages and attendance.
• File Form 6 (ESI return) annually.
• Provide updated employee list during inspection.
• Display ESI registration certificate at business premises.
